wiki.text:
In the Finnish language and Estonian language, the 'instructive case' has the
basic meaning of "by means of". It is a comparatively rarely used case, though
it is found in some commonly used expressions, such as omin silmin → "with one's
own eyes".

In modern Finnish, many of its instrumental uses are being superseded by the
adessive case, as in "minä matkustin junalla" → "I travelled by train."

It is also used with Finnish verbal second infinitives to mean "by ...ing", e.g.
"lentäen" → "by flying", "by air" ("lentää" = "to fly").

In Turkish, the suffix -le is used for this purpose. Ex: Trenle geldim "I came
via train".
